name: Affinia Dumont

reviews.text: This is now the only place I will stay in NYC. I booked a long weekend trip to the city for my mom and I. We were greeted and then were referred to by name anytime we went in or out. My mom loved it!
reviews.title: My new hotel in NYC

reviews.text: The location was close enough to a subway station that my mom had no trouble. The ability to choose my pillows was wonderful as my mom actually uses one of the special types.
reviews.title: Always a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our view was on the higher floors with a corner room and we had 2 full walls of windows. What a view!
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: I frequently visit NY for business and always make it a point to stay at the Dumont whenever possible. By NYC standards the rooms are very spacious and the staff is always extremely helpful. I always sleep very well in the comfortable beds and enjoy the selection of pillows they have to offer. The gym is large for a hotel (have not been to the spa) and the Barking Dog downstairs is always a sure bet for a decent meal at a reasonable price. The hotel is convenient to the subway and 3rd avenue has a great selection of restaurants.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: If you are a light sleeper I would recommend requesting a room on a high floor, as the street noise can often be a nuisance.
reviews.title: Spacious room, very comfortable, great location
Great location and views!
reviews.text: I found this hotel on a priceline 'name your own price' bid. It was located in the Midtown/Murray Hill area of Manhattan. It was just a few blocks from the Empire State building and relatively close to major highways and attractions. About a 20-25min walk to Time's Square and close to the 6 train's 33rd street stop on the subway. The hotel has great views (especially if you are the xx05 room on any floor.. corner room). You can see the beautiful skyline and Hudson from your room! The rooms have a mini-kitchen, large flat screen tv, a leather desk with chair, couch (in the corner room) and a nice bathroom. Beds were softer than the usual hotel bed which I really appreciated! The rooms were clean and had an iPod compatible clock radio. I feel that this is a hidden gem in Manhattan with non-Manhattan prices (especially on priceline.. I may have just gotten lucky as I paid $175 per night and got a free upgrade). Would definitely stay again. One downside is that the wireless is only free in the lobby -- otherwise it's about $13 per 24 hour use in your room.

reviews.title: Perfect Stay
reviews.text: I booked a junior suite at the Affinia Dumont at 150 34th St in New York City based on good reviews. Check in was at 3pm. I got there a little early so I had to wait till 3 because the room wasnt ready. At 3pm exactly I went back to the front desk to check in and my room still wasnt ready so they immediately upgraded me to a 1 bedroom suite. I went to NYC with my 2 sons, my friend, and her son. The front desk was very friendly and welcoming. When we got to our room we checked it out. It was very clean and exceeded our expectations. The kids were very happy and wanted to stay in the room for our entire vacation. There was a tv in the bedroom as well as a tv in the living room. A large desk and sofa bed also in the living room. The bathroom was a little small, but was very clean and updated. The kitchen, however, was very small also but a little outdated.

reviews.title: DON'T STAY HERE!
reviews.text: The service at this hotel was excellent. We called down to the front desk and asked for towels, they were pretty much brought to us immediately. We also called down for some sheets and blankets and pillows for the sofa bed, and we were brought warmed up sheets, and the blankets and pillows. We were very impressed with the warmed sheets.

reviews.title: Nice Place with Great Location!
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful with our questions about NYC, they gave us directions to different places, told us the best places to go and looked things up for us. They were fantastic! At the end of our stay, we were suppose to check out at 11 am, but the front desk allowed us to stay until 1pm. We were leaving NY at 10 pm and still had a whole day to do things in the city. The hotel allowed us to leave our luggage there until we were ready to pick them up and leave New York.

reviews.title: very spacious, but has cockroaches!
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. A 5 minute walk to Emire State Building, and a short cab ride to Times Square, very central to everything. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone, I will stay here again when I come back to New York City.
Just back from a five day stay at this hotel and I can definately say it is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed in .
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

likes.liked: — The level of service experienced , the nice relaxed atmosphere , the location

reviews.text: The level of service from all members of staff from the reception to house keeping was second to none - nothing was too much trouble . In particular a guy named alex was so helpful in recommending resturants and always really nice and polite. The hotel itself has a nice relaxed and genuine feel to it aided by the excellent staff .
reviews.title: Close to everything
hote in new york
reviews.text: A handy pack with maps and information about places to visit was given on checkin .

The room we stayed in was on the 18th floor , very spaceous room with excellent views ,a useful kitchen with a fridge and coffee maker , lots of storage space, a safety deposit box and air cond .The room also had an alarm clock which again was useful - especially adjusting to the time change .
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for anything better!

reviews.text: Beds very comfy and showers excellent . Even though the room was high up , traffic noise wasnt a problem , you couldnt hear a thing . Rooms serviced every day with fresh towels , linen and toiletries .
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great to see hotel lived up to its description. Spacious clean and comfy room.We had a studio on the 29th floor. Very quiet. Friendly staff, happy to oblige. Good location. What elso do you need? - a few sturdy pairs of shoes there is so much to see and do. All in all a great trip.
reviews.title: Good Choice

likes.liked: — Good location and spacios comfy room

reviews.title: Good, relatively quiet location with great staff
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on the final 2 nights of our US trip (25 - 27th August) as we wanted to try the Murray Hill area; lived up to previous reviews - yes, it is 'quiet' compared to other areas of NY but is still within walking distance of 5th avenue, 42nd St and times square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite booking via Priceline we were given an upgrade to a suite on the 30th floor; fantastic panoramic view of the Chrysler Building and the river.
reviews.title: Excellent experience - reviews are correct

reviews.text: This hotel is a spa/sport hotel with an in-house spa/sauna/pampering suite. Fresh fruit is in several areas of the hotel and is complimentary within the apartment. Pleased to find 2 large complimentary bottles of water in the suite. Used Room service once; was excellent and good value. The restaurants either side of the hotel looked good value.
reviews.title: a new favourite hotel

likes.disliked: — would have been great if there was a common area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff were very helpful and genuinuely friendly.
reviews.title: A hospitable staff = a fantastic hotel experience
Ok stay at the Affinia
reviews.text: Just returned from a trip to the US which ended with a 5 night stay at this Hotel. We booked it based on the trip advisor recommendations. It was the most expensive accomodation of our trip which given that it was New York was to be expected.

reviews.title: Peaceful oasis "far from the madding crowd"!
reviews.text: We thought it was well situated and given that the weather was lovely, we enjoyed many walks to and from the Hotel. The subway was not far away either.

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.text: Our room was on the 33rd floor and had a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building. The room was a good size although the bathroom was quite small and basic and overall for the money I thought it was a bit disappointing. The lobby and corridors were nothing special.The staff on the front desk were very courteous and helpful. On checking out we felt a bit pressurised by the doorman to book a taxi through him back to the airport for a fixed price.

reviews.title: Great choice!!
reviews.text: Not sure if we would return.

reviews.title: Best Hotel in NYC!
reviews.text: This Hotel came up on e-bookers way back in January 08 when I was searching for flights and hotels. Based on research in TripAdvisor I booked it. We stayed there 1st week in October and loved every minute. We arrived early, about 1pm and requested a room with a view. Receptionist stated that would be no problem but we would have to wait a while. However, she said she had a room ready on the 10th floor and if we wanted to see it go on up and if we didn’t like it come down and we could wait for room with a view. We went to 10th floor and found a huge corner room with two lovely beds, kitchen and bathroom. We couldn’t resist it and after long flight just flopped on the beds and decided to stay!

Second stay at this hotel and yet again very pleased. Loved the location and ambiance of the hotel. The staff was very professional and dedicated to providing you the best experience possible. Having the kitchenette was a huge plus and the room was very spacious and immaculately clean. The price was also very fair, overall a must stay for NYC!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Family of 5
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: Excellent room with plenty of space and amenities
reviews.title: Consistent

reviews.text: Very cost effective compared to many others we looked at
reviews.title: NIce hotel despite the scaffolding

reviews.text: Was able to get free wifi pretty much anywhere in the hotel
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a weekend getaway in Manhattan. The location is perfect -- walking distance from all the sights. Our 36th floor room was very large, with a comfortable bed, great view, nice Aveda soaps, and a "pillow menu" of 5 complimentary pillow choices. Yes, it's a gimmick, but it's unique. We had a kitchen, but didn't get to use it because there are so many nice restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Great value plus a menu of pillow choices

likes.liked: — High quality at a competitive price
likes.disliked: — Billing mix up on check out

reviews.text: The front desk staff were very good. I called ahead and arranged for champagne in our room on arrival, and the concierge took care of it and added a fruit plate too!
reviews.title: very nice hotel

likes.liked: — the cleanliness and convenience of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One problem we had was that 3 movies appeared on our bill, but we didn't even use the TV. (Who wants to watch tv on a weekend in Manhattan!) 2 of them were before 8am on Saturday, when, of course, we were asleep. It took an unfortunate amount of pleading with the desk and skeptical looks from the staff before they removed them from the bill -- it wasn't a nice way to leave, feeling as though they didn't believe us.
reviews.title: Excellent - would stay again!

reviews.text: Overall, I'd come back here. Expensive yes, but given the competition in New York, I think this place offers great value for your money.
reviews.title: A great small hotel

likes.disliked: — A sour smell in our room that we could not get rid of but got used to

reviews.text: We stayed at his hotel for 3 days at the beginning of June. Since there were 5 of us, we booked the 2 bd, 2 bth suite, and we were very pleased. It is an extremely clean hotel, the staff is friendly, and the location is decent (it's about 4-5 blocks from the Empire State Bldg). I cannot say enough good things about the room. It was a 2 bd apt pretty much, and it had lots of privacy in the bedrooms. Everything about it was very convenient, and we had a view of the Chrysler bldg! The only thing that we did not like was the room service. It was not good. We ordered the first day, but after that steered clear. However, there are a ton of shops right around the place and starbucks 2 blocks down, so it wasn't a problem. Plus, if you wanted to bring carryout back, you can warm it up in the microwave. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a stay in New York and would like to thank the Affinia Dumont Hotel for a wonderful stay. From the moment of entering the hotel we were impressed by the doorstaff and the helpfulness of the reception staff. This continued for the duration of our holiday. We had requested a room with a view but would like to thank the hotel for exceeding our expectation by providing us with a room on the 28th floor with a spectacular view of the Chrysler building in all its night and daytime glory. Our room was spacious and extremely comfortable and the facilities of a quality hotel supplemented by the ability to use the studio kitchen to eat in or out was a bonus. The position of the hotel was ideal providing easy walking to the Empire State Building ( 5 mins ) Macys ( 10 mins ) and Times Square ( 20 mins ) and superb subway links throughout Manhattan. Thank you to all the staff for a fantastic stay in your wonderful city!!!
reviews.title: Thank you for the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Affinia Dumont was definitely a great place to stay at. Stayed here for a week in May. It is centrally located in mid-town and within walking distance to many places. Very close to the Empire State building and a block away from subway stations. The room was larger than expected and included a kitchenette which comes in handy. Room was well kept and had a comfortable feeling. Staff were very polite and friendly as well. Complimentary refreshments and fruits were available to guests in the lobby. Would stay here again!
reviews.title: Great place to stay at!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As per previous reviews, I fully recommend the Affinia Dumont for a stay in New York. We stayed for 7 nights and could not have been happier with the hotel, its staff or the location.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: My family spent a weekend at the Affinia Dumont. The rooms are big and the location central, though the hotel completely messed up my family's reservation by guaranteeing (in writing) one room-type then not having it available when I got there. Of course, I was traveling with 4 people and they ended up putting us in a room with 1 bed and a pull-out couch. I was very upset and it put a blemish on our weekend. Initially they didn't seem to feel bad but after I expressed extreme disappointment they did apologize.
reviews.title: Big rooms, great location, bad reservations / room booking experience

likes.disliked: — The hotel messed up my reservations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also had been very impressed when making my reservation that they provided many options - you could reserve a crib, your pillow type - all sorts of preferences - NONE of them were in the system when I got there!
reviews.title: It is all true

reviews.text: I stayed at the Affinia Dumont with a friend on a shopping trip. Stayed there for 7 nights and found the overall service great. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels given each day! The staff were very friendly and happy to help with any questions you have. The location was great for us.... less than a 10 minute walk to Macey's. It's only a 2 minute walk to the Empire State Building. I preferred this hotel to my previous stay in New York, as there was very little noise from the street and the rooms were a bit bigger than the average hotel in New York. We had 2 great double beds with amazing pillows. (pillow menu is provided). The kitchenette was a good add on, but we didn't really use anything apart from the fridge. I'd definitely go back to the Affinia Dumont.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so happy with our stay at the Affinia. Loved the neighbourhood - so much less touristy and crowded than a lot of places in New York but great shopping is only a few blocks away at Herald Square. The subway is also only a block away.
reviews.title: Affinia Dumont the best!

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful. I asked for a room with a nice view and Matthew at reception accommodated us with a huge studio suite on the top floor facing north to the Chrysler building - amazing views! (Suite 3704 is gorgeous.) Donald, one of the bell staff, was also very helpful with answering our questions about New York. Housekeeping left a message for us to say they couldn't get into the room and to give them a call if we wanted them to come and clean - what service!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The room was impressive with a very comfortable king size bed, a big desk, a seating area and room to spare. The kitchenette is so convenient - just pick up lunch or dinner at the Murray Hill Market next door and heat up in the microwave! For a quick breakfast - Barking Dog next door will do the trick.
reviews.title: Perfect!!

likes.disliked: — Carpet in entrance hall due to lots of use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of all, we loved the feel of this hotel. Not too big but still so sophisticated and luxurious. (A couple of very minor suggestions for improvement - it would be nice if the tvs were upgraded to flat screens, also bathrobes would have been great). Can't wait to stay here again!!
reviews.title: DUSTY room, horrible housekeeping!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great location...was there end of aug-1st week in sept....ask fr a corner room...very large...2 queen beds!!!! very clean rooms...and accommodating staff....convenient and good restaurant adjoining hotel--the barking dog!!!! very pleasnat overall experience!!!!
reviews.title: Affectionate for Affinia Dumont

likes.disliked: — no concierge on premises to help with tickets to local events

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend in Manhattan and the accommodations at the Affinia Dumont far exceeded my expectations. Check-in was a breeze - - the clerk smiled through the entire 5-minute exchange and the bellman took our luggage promptly, telling us a little about the hotel and general area. The neighborhood (Murray Hill) is wonderful with small shops, lots of pub/restaurants and Gristedes, a lovely grocery where you can find anything you're looking for! Our studio suite was just that, sweet, but the toilet wouldn't flush. No problem! After maintenance showed up (fast!) and decided there wasn't a "quick fix" the front desk gave us another room, upgrading to a junior suite which was even better! Extremely roomy complete with a separate (fully stocked w/pots, plates, glasses, silverware) kitchen, this was our home away from home. We had a fantastic dinner at the Union Square Cafe Friday night, then Saturday night we just picked up some things from Gristedes 2 blocks away and had a picnic in our cozy, beautiful room. We could have saved maybe $12 a night parking at a different lot, but I felt my car was safer with Affinia and a few $$$ wasn't worth the worry. Each and every person we came into contact with at the hotel was friendly and efficient. Our unit was immaculately clean and the furnishings were plush. The bed was incredibly comfortable! We couldn't have been happier with the accommodations and will stay only with them whenever we travel to NYC. I've heard horror stories about other hotels, both from friends and from reviewers, and I feel confident that the Affinia Dumont will take good care of us next time too!
reviews.title: SO WORTH IT!

likes.liked: — So roomy for Manhattan - - we could have stayed a week!
likes.disliked: — Extra daily parking fee - maybe a discount if staying more than one night?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the hotel through hotels.com and got a great rate at around $250 a night for the king studio. Overall, the hotel was one of the best I stayed in.
reviews.title: Super hotel

reviews.text: The staff was wonderful at the hotel, especially Chris, the night doorman. The staff was very helpful and tried their best to help whenever possible. There was always iced tea and fresh fruit available in the lobby.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

likes.liked: — extremely comfortable beds and quiet rooms

reviews.text: The rooms were not as big as I expected, but I hear that is so for New York. There was a fridge and kitchen with dishes and pots and pans. The air conditioning was a bit loud, but that would be the only complaint. I'd recommend staying on the side that does not face the street if you want quiet. I stayed on the 11th floor facing the back (not the street). While there was no view, it was very quiet, and I was able to sleep in even though I am a light sleeper. The best thing is the hotel has self-service laundry in the basement, so we were able to do our laundry prior to our next destination. The beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was great. It was about a 3 to 5 minute walk to the subway. The Empire State building is a few blocks away as is Macy's.
reviews.title: It was just Okay

Check in was quick and easy, 4 lifts, all in order, all of the time. I was on the 32nd floor with views downtown.

reviews.text: The room was large with two double beds, a kitchen (with fridge freezer, oven, microwave plus pans, cutlery, plates etc), plus large desk and chair, plenty of wardrobe space and decent mirrors. The bathroom was smart with a powerful shower and Aveda toiletries (lovely!).

reviews.text: I never heard any of the other guests while there which made for a very peaceful stay. I didn't make use of the spa but would if I stayed again. There's also internet access in the lobby which was useful as I'd not brought a computer.

reviews.text: Just returned from New York after having a lovely holiday at the Affinia Dumont.

reviews.text: The hotel was well situated for exploring the city. It is a 5-20 minute walk from some of the main attractions (empire state building, rockefeller centre, grand central station and macy's etc)
reviews.title: Great Hotel...

reviews.text: The room was spacious, clean and had a lovely view of the city. The staff were very helpful and would be happy to oblige with any request or query.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel experience

likes.disliked: — No Wifi in rooms; rather expensive Internet connection fee.

reviews.text: The barking dog restaurant which is situated next door is also worth a visit whether you are looking for breakfast, lunch and dinner or simply just a relaxing drink.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Staff
Great location with some great staff
reviews.text: I would recommend a stay at this hotel.
My husband and a friend of mine decided to stay at Affinia Dumont based on other positive reviews. I was not disappointed! I have to say this by far one of the best values in NY!
reviews.title: My Favorite Part of Vacation

reviews.text: We arrived by taxi from LGA airport. It cost us about $50 taxi fare, but we were getting to the hotel around 4 pm and there was a bad accident about a block up from our hotel. After getting out of the taxi I went right to the front desk. I had no wait to check in. I had e-mailed the hotel concierge about a week prior to our stay requesting to make sure we were given a room with 2 beds (no pull out couch) and also requested a higher room with a view if possible. I also had asked some airport transfer questions and was told the room would be verified by guest services and my questions were answered promptly. Upon check-in we were put in room 3506, so 35th floor and our room looked both out onto the Hudson and also the Freedom Tower. WOW factor achieved!
reviews.title: Excellent family option

reviews.text: Our room was very clean (spacious according to my sister who travels to NY on business often) and roomy for 3 people. The location was great! We were next door to a Duane Reade (Drug Store), a deli, and donut shop. We were able to walk EVERYWHERE from the hotel, which we did. Most of the tourist things were only a short walk (about a mile or less). We stayed with Affinia Dumont for 5 nights and in that time frame we managed to walk 42 miles (I had on a pedometer), but we took in just about every Christmas tourist thing you could imagine!
reviews.title: Lovely, comfortable room
Overall a great stay
reviews.text: We did also take in wine hour from 5-6 our first night. Great welcome, but didn't love the wine selection so this was our only night joining. The wine server was VERY friendly and kept offering refills!

The only cons I would say to the hotel would be that for being on the 35th floor you still heard the sirens pretty clear (they do provide earplugs), but it is close to a hospital so that explains the sirens. The other con would be that they have a pillow menu and we changed pillows almost every night and didn't love the pillows. They pretty much were all flat and little support. I used 3 pillows and was fine, but my travel companions did not appreciate the pillows.
reviews.title: do your own research

reviews.text: My mother and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont between 11th Sept and 19th Sept. We went to eat in the hotel's restaurant, The Barking Dog on our third night, and suddenly saw a mouse running around the floor of the restaurant. It had a long tail, so it was either a mouse or a little rat. We immediately told the waitress, who said "oh yes that's been here all afternoon, we can't get it out" and walked off. A few minutes later, nobody seemed to be doing anything so we asked to see the manager (we were the only people eating in the restaurant). The manager said that the mouse / rat had come in from outside because they had the outside doors open. She said that this particular mouse frequently came in (obviously it hadn't occurred to her that there might be more than one mouse). We said that we were appalled, in the UK a restaurant would at least stop serving if a mouse was running around. She said that she'd called her boss, who told her to continue serving food. The mouse continued to run around the restaurant for the duration of our stay there. Our food came, needless to say we hardly ate anything, and asked for the bill. The bill was brought to our table, no thought of any reduction for the mouse. Eventually we spoke to the manager again who decided that as a "special gesture" she would cancel the bill. We felt honoured.
reviews.title: Mice in the restaurant

likes.disliked: — Mice (or rats) and nobody was really concerned about them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We immediately spoke to the duty manager of the Affinia Dumont who said that despite the fact that the Barking Dog is advertised on the hotel's website, despite the fact that the restaurant is recommended by the concierge as you arrive and despite the fact that all the hotel's room service comes from the restaurant, "it has nothing to do with the hotel". Evidently the hotel leases it to a separate company who do the catering on an agreement with the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location

likes.disliked: — Not a Traditonal Hotel as I would have expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day the restaurant was still serving food, and there was no talk of room service being suspended. I saw the same manager we'd spoken to on the Sunday evening (three nights later) who said that she had contacted the owner of The Barking Dog, who had said he was too busy to do anything about the mouse / rat. She said that there would be a meeting about the rodent the following day, so she suggested that the hotel had done nothing about this and allowed guests to continue eating food from the restaurant for three days.
reviews.title: What a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day, she said that she'd just found out that evidently a rat-catcher had come to the restaurant the day after we saw the mouse, and they had a clean bill of health. She offered us one night to be deducted from our bill.
reviews.title: Upgrade to Huge Corner Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I saw Jennifer Baldwin, a Director of Affinia Dumont as we were checking out. I said that I was surprised that we were being asked to pay anything for our stay. I had never eaten before in a restaurant with rodents running around, and was disgusted that this was treated in such a cavalier way. She apologised, but said that New York has a rodent problem, as though what had happened was kind of normal.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I honeymooned in New York and used the high marks from tripadvisor as a factor in choosing the Affinia Dumont. The high marks were well deserved. We were always warmly greeted by the bell hops, they even learned and remembered our names. We asked for a higher room on our first day and by our second we were given a room on the 29th floor. It is about two blocks from a subway station and near a number of decent restaurants. The cab fare to Times Square/Theater District ranged from $8-15 depending on traffic. We would definitely stay again when back in New York City.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.text: The affinia Dumont is a fabulous hotel - rooms large and very clean. Staff were very helpful with great recommendations for restuarants etc. Lots of really nice street cafes and bars near by.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: Loved our stay at Affinia Dumont! We were upgraded to a suite. Very spacious, clean room with comfortable beds. Extremely courteous and helpful staff. Great bargain for mid-town Manhattan. Would definitely recommend!
reviews.title: Loved the Affinia!

reviews.text: This is the best hotel in NYC in my opinion.
reviews.title: The best choice in NYC
A great hotel!
reviews.text: Although it is not in the Times Square area one can get there in about 15 min by taking the 6 train from 33rd/Park ave. one stop to Grand Central Station and the Times Square shuttle one stop to 7th avenue. This hotel is a few blocks from the Queens Midtown tunnel which makes for an easy arrival and return from LGA.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently traveled to NYC for the first time ever. We chose the Affinia Dumont based on TA reviews and the location. The hotel was great, but somewhat boring. It was nice, roomy, comfortable, and convenient. It wasn't luxurious which is kind of what we were expecting. The only thing that we found at Affinia Dumont that we have not found at others is the pillow service. They have a selection of 7 pillows that you can choose from. This was nice as we were able to try different pillows and see which would help relieve us the most. When we ordered our pillows, they arrived promptly.
reviews.title: Nice and spacious, good location
perfect
reviews.text: The location was good, but still about 2 blocks from the nearest subway station. (Although many travelers staying at this hotel will have no need for the subway).

Our room had a view, if you could call it that... it was a view of the rooftop patios of neighboring residential buildings. There's no real "good view" due to the location of the hotel and surrounding buildings.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — Should have more detailed information on dining in NYC.

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, the hotel was great. I just had very high expectations and was a little disappointed... to no fault of the hotel or staff, just my own raised expectations.
reviews.title: Another outstanding stay at the Affinia Dumont

likes.liked: — location -- within walking distance for most things
likes.disliked: — on a busy street that allows a little street noise

reviews.title: We were "WOWED"
reviews.text: i stayed there with my daughter and the rest of my family, we had rooms on the 31st and 33rd floors, the views were amazing, and the staff were great, and they all loved my daughter to bits, if i was to go back to new york i would go back and stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at budget motels to five diamond/star hotels. The Affinia Dumont is above average on our books and we wouldn't hesitate staying at the property again. The hotel is a very good value for Manhattan.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong with the hotel

reviews.text: Check in was smooth. The front desk briefed us on the hotel facilities and the neighborhood. We requested and got a high floor with a magnificent view north. The room , a spacious studio with small bathroom and kitchen, was spotless. Every hotel employee we crossed paths with were courteous and friendly.
reviews.title: traveling with 5 month old at the affinia

reviews.text: We had dinner at the hotel restaurant which was good. The neighborhood around the hotel is much less hectic than the Times Square area.
reviews.title: Looking forward to staying again!

reviews.text: Where do I start? This was the best hotel for kids, we had 4 girls and a baby and managed to fit everyone very spacious. We stayed at a hotel last year and we could not open our suitcases at the same time it was awful. We had a room with a kitchenette and the crib fit perfectly in there. The bathroom was spacious with Aveda products yummy. We were a block from the 6 train which is great. Walking distance to midtown, Macy's, Empire State Building lots of stores along the way. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. They managed to get us into Wolfgang Puck's Steakhouse very last minute on friday night. We could not have loved this hotel more and will definitely stay there again and again.
reviews.title: Great location restaurant does a lovely breakfast

reviews.text: I booked our reservation for March 6th - 10th after reading glowing reviews on Trip Advisor, and could not have been more pleased. We arrived a bit early, so we walked to the adjoining Barking Dog restaurant and had an excellent leisurely lunch (their chicken caesar wrap is excellent, and we loved their breakfasts!). The Barking Dog restaurant also delivers room service to the Affinia. When we checked in at 3:00, we were very pleased to see all of the ROOM in our room! We stayed in room #3006, which had two excellent views of the East River. Two queen-sized beds, and a full desk which came in handy when writing in my trip journal at the end of each day. Not only was the room itself huge, but the bathroom was as large and comfortable as my own at home. No crowding your personal products together in a corner to make room for brushing your teeth. No cramped shower...as a matter of fact, the shower was one of the best features - excellent water pressure! We enjoyed the Aveda products that the hotel provided, not just your run-of-the-mill Dial soap and V05 shampoo. The staff was very friendly and eager to make our trip as enjoyable as possible, even providing a fan for our use in the room. We loved the doormen...they had great input as far as good restaurants in the area. Excellent, excellent facilities and service...will definitely stay again!
reviews.title: actually didn't get to stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a New Yorker Festival Weekend (Oct 5-7, 2007) at the Affinia Dumont near midtown Manhattan. I can't say enough good things about the hotel. It's well appointed, has modern bed & bath, and a friendly staff. The rooms are unusually spacious for New York, including a lovely modern desk and a functional kitchen in our studio king. The location is a good starting point for a lot of activities in New York. You can easily walk to the Empire State Building, 5th Ave, the library, Penn Station, etc. The nearest subway is the number 6 on Park Ave. which is not the best, but works ok to get downtown.
reviews.title: Excellent New York Hotel

reviews.text: Just back from a five night stay at the wonderful Affinia Dumont.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

reviews.text: The weather was hot for our stay and it was great to get back to the air conditioned room which was so comfortable. We were three women on a shopping spree and the doormen were so heplful when we arrived with our shopping., especially Christopher. also Ronaldo for getting us a taxi to the theater.
reviews.title: Loved the Affinia Dumont!

reviews.text: Like all the other reviews no complaints with the housekeeping or reception they were excellent. The area itself it so safe with the Murray hill market just at the corner for stocking up on water, milk etc. Will definitely go back to the Affinia Dumont.
reviews.title: Best value for your money!

likes.liked: — big room - junior executive suite, great view
likes.disliked: — no free internet access, no ccokware in mini kitchen

reviews.text: My mom and I visited NYC for my "dream trip" in August, and the Affinia Dumont was fabulous. I had contacted the hotel via email about a month prior to the trip, letting them know that it was a special vacation, and that if possible, we would appreciate having a room with two beds on a high floor (our original reservation was a king room). They happily met our request! We stayed in a double queen studio suite, and the room was very large. We absolutely loved having the kitchen! There are a lot of delis/grocery stores in the area where we could get cheap breakfast.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay at The Affinia Dumont

likes.liked: — Everything - friendly, helpful staff and great rooms and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marvelous hotel, great location, will stay here again.
reviews.title: Marvelous!

reviews.text: Stayed 7th Aug for a few nights. I added a "high floor room pls" request when booking with expedia but that hadn't reached the hotel - no problem, they changed the room to 28th floor corner room straightaway. The rooms are spacious, traffic noise not a problem, the staff were very helpful & the large fridge was a god-send.
reviews.title: Loved the Affinia Dumont

likes.disliked: — You must leave the hotel to get to the restaurant which is next door.

reviews.text: The in-room drinks & snacks are overpriced as you'd expect, but there's murray hill market to the left & duane reed (like a large corner shop for UK types, don't be put off by the "drug store" name) over the road to the right and a slightly larger shop round the corner (north) on 3rd ave.
reviews.title: Great position in Manhattan

reviews.text: We didn't eat at the Barking Dog. We tried Penelope's (lexington & 30th) for breakfast and found it ok if not special. EJs luncheonette on the upper east side was our fave breakfast place, or Celeste's diner at the brooklyn end of the brooklyn bridge.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: We used the subway a lot & would recommend the $25 weekly metro card if you're here for a few days. The subway stop is close (park & 33rd) as is the empire state building.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: An absolutely fantastic hotel. Located just a few minutes away from the empire state building, macys etc. Rooms really modern and spacious with kitchen area. I'm planning to go to New York again this year and will definitely be staying at the Affinia Dumont and i suggest you do to!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a MUST! The staff are incredibly helpful and very friendly, the room was HUGE- we got a corner room which had a king sized bed, fab bathroom and a kitchenette with oven, crockery and fridge. 1807- I think..
reviews.title: Amazing-Please Read This!!!

likes.liked: — Size and decor of the room

reviews.text: This is nothing like most pokey NY hotels, the decor is very contempory and, as I'm BA Crew, I'm used to the best and am VERY fussy! Trust me, there is nothing to not like about this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel - excellent location!

reviews.text: The location is excellent, about 22 blocks south of central park, 5 blocks East of the empire state (almost next door!) and theres an all night deli next door where you can buy ready made fresh food you can heat in the microwave or oven in your room if you want to watch your pennies. We had a junior suite and had such a fantastic stay Jan 8th-11th 2009, we will definately return. I've stayed in lots of hotels in NY and this is, without doubt, the best. This was our Honeymoon (or part of it) and we were not disappointed.

reviews.title: A wonderful experience

reviews.text: Hotel staff are so polite and helpful and nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. The front desk staff in particular are just great.

reviews.title: Great place to chill out in crazy, busy city.

reviews.text: New York was the last stop of our three city tour. After opting for cheaper accommodations in Boston and Washington, we (two couples, no children) were happy to spend a little bit more money in New York for a comfortable hotel. The Affinia Dumont hotel was lovely and we were very happy with our choice. Our rooms were massive - bigger than some studio flats I've lived in and nicer than some 5 star hotels I've stayed in - with kitchen (oven, microwave, coffee maker, crockery, cuttlery, glasses), bathroom and comfortable chairs to lounge on. The room service food and drink comes from the restaurant/bar adjacent to the hotel and was reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Nice stay, but neither fitness nor luxury, some rough edges

likes.liked: — overall feel, location, views from room

reviews.text: we stayed in a junior suite. These rooms are amazing. Large bed, lovely bathroom, a really nice little kitchenette, a nice sitting area as well as desk but it also has amazing views.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Affinia

reviews.text: The location is great as it's really central, the staff are really nice and I can't recomend this hotel enough. Both our stays here were brilliant
reviews.title: Well worth it!

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel on business, with a weekend added on. The staff were very helpful (Housekeeping), and the hotel loans bikes (4), which you can reserve for up to four hours. Other than the rude person who did not return their bike on time, I found this a very nice addition, as it allowed me to see the city, visit friends, attend a church and get a round without having to drop a bunch of cash on cabs, or, negotiate an unfamiliar subway. The room was spacious, with a decent working desk, and a kitchen with cooking utensils, stove, and refrigerator. I could do laundry on Sunday morning easily. Overall a nice stay so far.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed 6 nights at the Affinia Dumon with the family. The hotel is superbly located, a few blocks from the Empire building and from the United Nations. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff was very much welcoming and pleasant to interact with. The beds are fantastic, sheets were crisp and fresh and the shower was great, hot with amazing pressure.
reviews.title: Great place in a great spot but some improvements are necessary
Avoid this Hotel at All Costs: They Gave our Reservation Away
reviews.text: I would give the hotel 5 stars but some issues need to be underscored.
With so many hotels in NYC, each one must provide exceptional amenities, especially if they aim at charging over $300 per night for a room. Here are the issues we believe the hotel must work on
reviews.title: A gem in the city

reviews.text: 1) No air conditioning in the corridor/hallways. What's up with that? As soon as you leave your room to get an elevator, you are stuck in a corridor with no ventilation. None at all. The air is stall and humid. For what purpose? Save a few bucks? When you are in the $300/n range, you cannot skim on stupid things like that.
reviews.title: Excellent price for very good accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to New York and like so many other people used Trip Advisor to decide where to stay. We weren't disappointed as on arrival we were shown to our suite on the 33rd floor where the views were just astounding. The room was huge with a king size bed plentiful on-suite bathroom, sofas, an office desk plus a kitchen. The room was very clean and tidy which is what you'de expect from a hotel of this calibre. The staff were very friendly and helpful when requesting directions or ideas.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Affinia Dumont is in a super location, on East 34th Street within easy walking distance of the Empire State Building and Macy’s. The Barking Dog restaurant next door is a perfect place for breakfast lunch or dinner as we had all 3 at some point during our stay and enjoyed each one.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had let the hotel know in advance that it was my wifes 40th birthday treat and on arrival found a complimentary card and cake in the room which was a lovely touch.
reviews.title: Affinia Dumont - Short Review

reviews.text: We would definitely stay at the Affinia Dumont again and fully intend too when we return in a couple of years time
reviews.title: Great place!

likes.liked: — The pillow menu...and the proximity to Penelopes!

reviews.text: The hotel on 34th St is located a short walk from the Empire State Building and Macy's. Penn station is a few blocks away. The junior suite overlooking 34th St was very clean, well maintained and spacious with good quality fittings and furniture including living room space, office desk, phone/fax and computer facilities. There is plentiful wardrobe space and an in-room safe for valuables. The bathroom (good size) and kitchenette were well appointed and the king bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel does not have a dining room facility but a small restaurant bar is located directly next door. There is a mini market, supermarket and laundry facility if you need these nearby. A number of good quality, reasonably priced restaurants and bars are a short walk away in and around 3rd Avenue. Ethos (Greek) or Hudsons Restaurant and Bar are recommended. We booked directly through the hotel website and paid in advance receiving the best available rate. The hotel was ideal for a six night stay in New York and we would certainly stay at the Affinia Dumont again.
reviews.title: Comfort and Convenience - Affinia has it all

likes.liked: — comfortable beds, quiet hotel at night

reviews.text: There are several Affinia's in New York - this is the Dumont at 150 East 34th Street.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Room: GREAT!!! BIG by NY standards. Two queen beds, plenty of space between and on outside of each bed. Pillows not the best (too small and soft) but they do offer a selection of other pillows if you want one or two. There were only two sleeping pillows on each bed, but there were also two extra large, square pillows with decorative sham covers. Sheets were a bit stiff - like they were overly starched or something and very "noisy" when you'd move around during the night. Huge mirror on bedroom area, along with large TV and very big desk area. Bathroom was sufficient, although not a lot of counter space. Nice that they provide good sized body soap, shampoo and conditioner which they refill during your stay. Kitchen was very nice to have. There was service for 4, so you have to wash pretty frequently. Closet is small. There is a safe in the room.
reviews.title: A great stay
Great hotel in excellent location
reviews.text: View: We were lucky to have a room on the 32nd floor, with windows on 2 sides, so view was AMAZING. We were looking south (at Freedom Tower) and east to the river.
Lobby: It's tiny, so don't count on a place to hang out.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: People: Front desk was very responsive to requests. Housekeeping folks were SO NICE!!! (There are self-serve washers and dryers in basement: $2:00 wash / $1.00 soap / $2.00 dry)
reviews.title: Good value when traveling with family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the reviews are completely true, Affinia Dumont is fantastic. Not only is the location ideal, the property and staff are excellent. Prior to arriving my boyfriend emailed the concierge to check the possibility of a room with a view as it was my birthday during our stay. Not only did they oblige, they gave us the penthouse (Room 3704) with the most incredible view of uptown and The Chrysler building. The reception staff were very helpful with general information about New York and booking attractions. Many thanks, we had a wonderful stay at Affinia Dumont.
reviews.title: Many thanks for a wonderful stay

reviews.text: After an extensive search ao on tripadvisor.com booked the Affinia Dumont based on rave reviews. And was very, very happy with that decision upon arriving. Were welcomed in a very warm and welcoming way by Iris, and her warm professionalism was carried thru the next days by her colleagues. Upon arriving our room was what we hoped for; very spacious, and with a simply wonderful view over both the Hudson River and downtown. As I had advised it was a special trip for my daughters 18th birthday, there was even a (delicious) chocolate birthday cake waiting for us! The separate kitchen area was just wonderful as several nights we were simple too exhausted to sit in a restaurant so we bought something from one of the many deli's and cooked ourselves a simple meal. Apart from being very spacious, the room also had wonderful beds and - very important for a terrible sleeper like myself - really great beds. Also, though you could faintly hear the bustle of NY going on, it didn't disturb our good nights' sleep. Further would like to add that room was kept extremely clean. Unfortunately didn't have time to use either gym or spa, but did take a peek and it looks wonderful. Had some trouble with the internet one night, and within a few minutes someone came up; service was very prompt. I really can't find fault with this hotel or with its wonderful staff. Though I've read in reviews about other NY hotels that the size or comfort really doesnt matter as you're not in NY to sleep, I have to disagree. Especially after getting up early and do nothing but walk and sightsee all day long, knowing we had this wonderful, peaceful hotelroom to go back to was great. All in all; excellent value for money, cannot recommend it highly enough! This first visit to New York definitely left us wanting to go back, and we will not hesitate but book directly with the Affinia Dumont.
reviews.title: Simply loved the Affinia Dumont

likes.liked: — Size of rooms, cleanliness, friendliness staff

reviews.text: I was placed at the Affinia Dumont by the company I was working for in New York for two weeks. I hadn't heard of it, though I lived for many years in Manhattan. I LOVED the hotel. The service is as good as it gets in the U.S.---and not the fake attitude of service that a lot of pricey places try to substitute for the real thing. The staff at the Affinia Dumont all delivered wonderful, cheerful, genuinely helpful service. Our suite was cozy, well appointed, had real separation between the rooms, and a perfect little kitchen. Right next door and across the street are delis and sandwich shops so it's easy to stock the kitchen if you like. The fitness center has plenty of machines, and supplies headphones for the TVs that are on all the treadmills and elliptical machines. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to get everywhere in the city from there---lots of cabs in the neighborhood. We were on a high floor and it was quite quiet. I would stay there again any time. A pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: Love the Affinia Dumont

likes.disliked: — I think Internet access should be wireless and free.

reviews.text: We've just arrived back from a short trip to NY and stayed 3 nights at the Affinia Dumont.

reviews.text: We were in New York to be married and the hotel staff were excellent with us. From the moment we met the concierge we knew we'd picked the right place and if first impressions are anything to go by then we were very happy.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: After reading so many reviews of this hotel I had a good idea of what to expect when we arrived. I took some advice from one contributor and emailed the hotel asking for a room with a view, they replied saying that they would do their best but could not guarantee anything. Well we weren't disappointed!! We had booked a one bedroom suite as we were taking our teenage son and wanted a bit of space; however when we booked in we were upgraded and were not only given a one bedroom suite but were also given a fitness room with a sauna and another bathroom!! I have never stayed in a hotel with so much room before!!(and probably never will again!!). We also had a superb view of the Chrysler building. One of my best memories will be of doing a yoga workout looking out over the New York Skyline!!! The staff were really friendly and I liked the fact that it didn't feel pompous! The Murray Hill area was great; it was fantastic to be staying away from all the crowds and all the hustle and bustle yet walking distance from so many places. We did try the Murray Hill diner but ended up going to the local deli and buying our own supplies for breakfast. We went to the River Cafe for 'Brunch' on Sunday which was superb. We also went to the NY Nicks basketball game at Madison Square Garden and had free drinks and food all night as it was their last game!! It was an experience just watching the amount of food some people can put away!! We found a great little fish restaurant in Greenwich Village called Mary's Fish Camp (they have a website) - very small but great food. We also visited Central Park Zoo which I was a bit apprehensive about but ended up enjoying. Would thoroughly recommend the Top of the Rock for views; we went twice and the first time we had a lift to ourselves - both times were quite quiet. We went to the Top of the Empire State building at about 10pm - we didn't have to queue but it still seemed busy at the top. We were getting very frustrated by being sent all around the houses to get to the top even though it wasn't busy! It definitely has more of a touristy feel than the TOTR.
reviews.title: 'Wow' what a view!

likes.liked: — The upgrade!! The views and the spacious rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at Affinia Dumont for three nights 11-14th of April, fantastic! First time in New York to celebrate my husbands 40th and can't wait to return! Like many others we booked the Affinia Dumont because of the reviews. Hotel is exactly as described, no surprises all good! Arrived early evening shattered after delay with Virgin. Reception very quick and efficient, made us feel relaxed and at home straight away, gave us keys and maps and information. We had a one bedroomed suite on the 32 floor, I had asked for a very quiet room as was worried about sleeping and that's what we got, all that could be heard were the distant sounds of the sirens, no noise from any other room and they were occupied. This was a surprise trip and had told my husband to expect a small room (the norm for NY hotels so I am informed). He was amazed when we entered our suite, large room with sofa, two chairs, desk, tv, midi system, books, mini bar snacks etc. Small but very adequate kitchen inc. dishwasher, coffee maker with free coffee! Microwave, toaster, oven and hob, full size fridge/freezer stocked with mini bar drinks, all the usual plates etc, everything you need! Separate bedroom with very comfortable huge bed and three lovely pillows (chosen from pillow menu). Bathroom good size, full bath and shower, sink and toilet, plenty of soft white fluffy towels and toiletries. The whole suite was immaculate, even the taps and grout, (I had read a lot about grotty bathrooms!) We were on the side/rear corner overlooking the East river, uninterrupted views! Beautiful to watch the sun rise before setting off for the busy streets! Ordered room service that night as late, huge pizza for £7, more than plenty for two adults.
reviews.title: So glad we chose to stay here!

likes.liked: — It's location and it's staff were first rate.
likes.disliked: — Can't think of any negative points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the lovely residential area of Murray Hill, with local diners including Barking Dog (really missing their food)! and markets (corner shops) with hundreds of beautiful fresh flowers for sale outside! This was the only place we saw this in NY and it added a sense of wellness and sophistication to the area. This is a lovely tranquil area to return to at the end of the day. Checking out is noon but as our flights were in the evening we checked out early and Affinia kindly stored our bags for the day, I knew that they offered this service free of charge from the other reviews, this gave us the whole of our last day free from luggage, we did see many people walking around with theirs! When we returned we had free use of the spa changing rooms/toilets to freshen up before leaving. They arranged a car to JFK for $65, taxi to the hotel had been $57, so it was very reasonable. Nothing was ever too much trouble for this hotel, the staff were always there for us. I know these reviews are read by the hotel, so thank you Affinia Dumont for a wonderful stay. Tracey T, Bournemouth, England.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided on the Affinia Dumont having had a recommendation from a colleague who told us that it was middle of the road, fairly central and that it did not cost the earth. We booked the hotel through their website and asked for a room with a view, on a high floor. We mentioned that we would be on honeymoon and said that we would welcome any special treatment they wanted to give us. When we arrived, we were greeted by a very friendly staff member who told us that we had been given a beautiful suite. We were delighted when we arrived at the suite to discover a panoramic view of the Chrysler Buidling on one side and the river on the other. The room was a good size, was clean and in good condition. The room cost us 1,800 us dollars for five days, which was a little more that we had inended to spend but we definitely felt that we were given value for money. We had a wonderful time and could not complain about the Affinia Dumont.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great location!!

We both loved the hotel, the room was excellent with fridge, mini bar, even a complimentary umbrella which proved useful! The king size bed was HUGE, everything was clean and the room was a good size.

reviews.text: We had breakfast at the Barking Dog next door a couple of times, this was perfectly pleasant but there was a great deal of delis and diners around to choose from which I preferred overall.

I did not like my first room and was able to change with no trouble (or attitude). The front desk staff was lovely and housekeeping and bellmen were friendly.

Room was clean and in good repair.

reviews.text: My flight was not until 8:30pm and I was able to easily stash my bags for the day.
reviews.title: Fabulous. My New York home away from home.
Everybody happy
reviews.text: our first trip to nyc with our sons and this hotel provided everything we all wanted. great location, quiet area, very friendly staff, nearby markets to ease the cost of eating out and great views. having two boys in a room for any period of time can be taxing, but the junior suite provided just enough room and the great view eased the boys cabin fever as they spent most of our in room time checking out the view, the helicopter landings, the window washers, etc. the staff greeted us each time we came or went and the boys had us take photos of them with their favorites. we chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and were not let down.

reviews.title: We couldn't have been made more welcome!
reviews.text: So, I'm taking my mother-in-law to NYC for a girlie shopping weekend, and it's her first trip to America at the age of 74 - and the first thought I have is where on earth should we stay? Certainly not near Times Square (too noisy), and not Downtown (not enough shops), nor on the Upper East / West side (again, not enough shops!) - so we went for the gorgeous area of Murray Hill where the Affinia Dumont is based - and both the location and the hotel turn out to be PERFECT - a quiet location, but just 15 minutes walk from Macy's!

reviews.title: Nicest hotel we've stayed at in NYC
reviews.text: Just to put some perspective on the almost unanimously positive reviews for this hotel - it's fantastic, but not because its a luxury hotel (it's not, it's a solid 4 star, well set up for business or leisure travellers with large rooms including huge desks, a kitchenette, and a lovely views for the higher floors ) - the reason for the reviews are because the Affinia Dumont staff (on the front desk, concierge, spa, door etc) really take customer service seriously. They are definitely the most genuinely helpful hotel staff I have ever come across (and I travel a lot), and they seem to really enjoy their jobs which shows because they make the effort to welcome you to their hotel and city with such enthusiasm.

reviews.title: In a word....FANTASTIC!
reviews.text: I can honestly say that although NYC was fabulous as always, the Affinia Dumont made this trip a "holiday of a lifetime" for my mother-in-law. Thank you to everyone we met, and I'll definitely be back.

reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel
reviews.text: We've stayed in maybe 10 different hotels in NYC over the last 3 years -- the joys of having a child in college in the city. We usually go as cheap as possible -- given that all the cash goes to pay for college.

reviews.text: The Affinia Dumont is marketed as a "fitness hotel," and its many accoutrements reflect this philosophy throughout its experience. It's only from these various thoughtful features, though, that you'd guess it was a fitness hotel, since the guests look the same as any other medium-to-high-end hotel in Manhattan, not exclusively the lean, low-cholesterol, somewhat toned specimens you might expect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted on entry by a couple friendly faces at the front desk, surrounded by a canister of iced tea and a bowl of fresh fruit (because they're healthy). A set of free weights in a plexiglas cabinet looked less out of place than you would expect. As it was in the morning and our room wouldn't be available until 3p, an extremely robust bellhop named Christian took our luggage and promised to keep it safe. We had no doubts.
reviews.title: Staff were fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are enormous by NYC standards. You could easily roll out a yoga mat or two and do your sun salutations while meditating on the downtown skyline (ask for a south-facing room on high floor if this is appealing). Most shocking to my eyes was the desk in the corner with a Herman Miller Aeron chair. Paradise! If you need to do any kind of work in your hotel, this is the place to stay. It would be perfect except for the daily usurious internet charge of $9.95. But you'll pay it with a smile as you relax in the Aeron. After you're done working (or stretching), you can fry up an omelette (egg whites only, of course) in the kitchen, equipped with a gas stove and full-size refrigerator.
reviews.title: Really great location, very good room, overall good value

reviews.text: Several menus were in the room. A room service menu from the restaurant next door; a fitness menu describing some sort of "fitness kits"; and a pillow menu with at least seven (!) kinds of bed-based head support options, including buckwheat, feather, hypoallergenic, memory foam, magnetic, and other alternatives that I've never heard of before. Also available was an "intimacy kit" in case all that yoga on the Aeron chair gets your chi flowing - very thoughtful.
reviews.title: fabulous NYC experience

reviews.text: In my bleary-eyed state, I failed to notice that the fitness theme had stretched even into the elevator, where a small monitor played kickboxing, yoga, and pilates videos in the morning. Everyone in the videos was smiling, beautiful, and taut. I think they change the videos to ESPN in the afternoons.
reviews.title: Affinia Dumont was \as good as advertised

reviews.text: While the staff at The Affinia Dumont hotel were friendly and made good efforts to be accommodating, our one-night stay was dissatisfying as we were not informed of a room request change in advance. Our family needed a room with two double beds and upon check-in were told we had an "upgrade" to a King size bed with sleeper sofa, which was less than adequate for our needs. In addition our request for a higher floor room was not honored and were unfortunately on the 7th floor facing 34th Street, which was quite noisy throughout the evening. Disappointing experience as we were celebrating my sister's 60th birthday and coming from Connecticut to New York City involved a bit of planning, which included the choice to stay at The Affinia Dumont....so sorry to have a less than positive review as it otherwise seemed like a nice hotel - - if one's accommodation is not changed without notice.

reviews.text: We are from England and the last time we stayed in New York City we had a terrible hotel. After researching reviews on Trip Advisor and getting prices we chose the Dumont and were so pleased with it overall. OK. the foyer looks a bit jaded, but the staff are helpful and the rooms are clean and spacious, comfortable beds, good bed linen, bathroom etc. I think they would go up a further notch if they supplied bathrobes but that's just a niggle. It is really central for all attractions and shopping. We booked with Quikbook.com and got an excellent rate.
reviews.title: Nice Stay in NY

reviews.text: As with other reviews this hotel is indeed in a great location. For those with a disposition for walking it is well placed to walk to most places on Manhatten within 60-90 mins. For those who want to use public transport there is an underground station 5 mins walk away and there are several bus route pickups close to the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the Affinia Dumont!

likes.liked: — Size of room, location, friendliness of staff

reviews.text: I stayed at the dumont with a group of six for one night. We got a 1 bedroom suite with two queen beds and a pull out sofa. The room was awesome, on the 35th floor with an incredible view of the city. Everything in the room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. The beds were amazingly comfortable! It was a great time and I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat, also the people at the front desk are very nice and the restaurant has an awesome breakfast selection for very reasonable prices...I had a fantastic omelet with hash browns and a biscuit for under nine bucks! You can't beat that In NY!
reviews.title: Loved it!
Wonderful hotel!
reviews.text: Spent four nights in this hotel. Found the staff and the room to be top notch. Tennille at the front desk is a real gem. It was my husband and I's first trip to NYC. The bathtub was LONG enough to let me stretch out after walking, walking, walking in NYC for a good soak with some epsom salts. For you women, the hotel uses Aveda toiletries, which is a nice touch. They work hard to make your stay very pleasant and there are plenty of amenities. We had a full kitchen (which we never used because we didn't have time). The only downside was a small dog barking but it didn't seem to bark at night so not a problem. You don't have to go any further in your research ... stay here.
