reviews.text: I'm not sure that everybody is revewing the same hotel here. The Affinia Dumont is certainly not opposite Penn Station!
reviews.title: Overrated, is everybody reviewing the same hotel?
A pleasant surprise.
reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed with the hotel, aside from the large rooms it didn't really do much for me. Despite a request when the booking was made (several months ago) for a high room with views we were on the 10th floor, they only had high floors available with single beds. No major problem but a little customer care goes a long way. The Concierge was actually whoever was on reception and in this instance was very poor, a request to confirm some restaurant reservations that we had made was noted but not acted upon, we discovered this when the restaurants in question rang to confirm our reservations themselves several hours later. When we requested information on getting to the airport we were pointed to the station and told that they couldn't call us a shuttle bus, we would have to do it ourselves!

reviews.title: A gem
reviews.text: The rooms were large but old fashioned, the air conditioning units were very loud and I dread to think what it must be like during the summer. Noise from adjoining rooms and across the hallway was especially prevalent, lots of hotels have locked adjoining doors to rooms but the gaps between them left a lot to be desired and televisions and telephone conversations were clearly audible despite not being particularly loud and so much light came through from the neighbouring room that we had to block the doorway with towels.
Overall I was disappointed and would have preferred a smaller room with better services. I struggle to understand why this is even in the top ten hotels in New York, let alone ranked number 3!
reviews.title: Great!!! Go!!! Stay!!! Enjoy!!!

reviews.text: This hotel is quite nice and clean, with huge rooms, excellent showers, comfortable beds, and very clean throughout. The gym has many options for however you like to work out. The neighborhood has tons of options for bars, restaurants just around the corner on 3rd. The funny thing is, the breakfast is delivered in a brown paper bag like it was picked up elsewhere, but it was good, just nothing fancy. I usually stay downtown in "hipper" hotels, which this place isn't, but if you're ok with not running into wannabes, it's fine. However, for the price, around $379 + tax, broadband internet should be included in-room, instead of the $45/week charge.
reviews.title: WOW!!!! Stay here!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Although a bit expensive, this is a very good hotel, great location, nice and clean rooms, good service. I can recommend this to everyone.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.text: The Affinia Dumont was once again a wonderful facility for our 6 night New York visit. My 22 year old daughter and I requested a high floor with view of Chrysler Bldg. We arrived late and our room was ready as requested. The pillow menu is wonderful. I selected the Swedish temperpeudic and my daughter fluffy down pillows. The bed is very comfortable. The best part for me is the location. It is in a fairly quiet part of the city in Murray Hill. The 6 subway is just a short 2 block walk which takes you past a Starbucks. Empire State Building is easy walking distance as is Macys. The Murray Hill Market is right next door for those breakfast items and to pick up things for the room. A full kitchenette is in each room, so it is very handy to keep things fresh. Of course we would never cook while on vacation...being able to keep fresh juice, milk, half and half...perfect. I can't say enough about the staff. The doormen and desk staff are wonderful. They warmly welcome you back each time you arrive. Iced cold iced tea and fresh fruit are available at the front desk which is so nice after long walks around the city. For the price this is a great deal for New York as far as room size and facility. I call the Affinia Dumont my New York home.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: What an awsome place to stay!!! Four of stayed at the Dumont from 6/11-6/17/08 and the service can not get any better anywhere. The rooms are huge by NYC standards. They gave us a beautiful view on the 33rd floor of the river. It was breathtaking!!!
reviews.title: Loved the Dumont

likes.liked: — The large rooms and excellent service

reviews.text: Rooms are so clean and the kitchen is an extra bonus. Nice to have a place to keep bottled water cold and left over food.
reviews.title: Terribly Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sara Candee you are a wonderful person and so caring. Thank you for all you did for us. We will be staying with you when we return to NYC hopefully during the holidays.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: My daughter, her friend and myself stayed at the Affinia Dumont for 5 days last week. This was one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. Our room was on the 31st floor and we had a corner room. The views were spectacular. Everyone was completely helpful. We were complete novices in the big city and the staff was always helpful and friendly. After seeing some of the other hotels that I was considering choosing, I am sooooo glad that we chose this one. We chose the Dumont because of the reviews on this website and they were completely on target. Thanks for making my daughter's graduation trip so wonderful.
reviews.title: Should be a 5 Star!!!!!!

reviews.text: We went to New York for a week to celebrate our daughter's 18th birthday and high school graduation. We booked the Affinia Dumont based on TripAdvisor reviews and loved it! Initially, I was worried about the cleanliness of hotels in New York City, but the Affinia was exceptionally clean and stylish. The staff was also wonderful-so friendly and helpful. My daughter loved the sound pillow and complimentary iced tea. The hotel offers many amenities, such as bathrobes and specialty pillows, but you have to ask for them. We ate at the Barking Dog next door a few times-the food was okay. Although we took a taxi to Times Square and used the subway often due to the hotel's distant location, I highly recommend the Affinia Dumont. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful, clean hotel

likes.disliked: — Distance to Times Square and Central Park

reviews.text: Stayed here in July 2008. Staff are very friendly, location is good, rooms are good size for New York but the room we stayed in needed to be steam cleaned. The carpets were dirty and the furniture needed to be steam cleaned or replaced. This is not the fault of the day to day cleaners as linen, kitchen area and bathroom were clean and they have done all they can. The lobby is nice and beautifully tiled but please replace the carpets in the lift as they are a big let down. Asked for a recommendation for a restraunt one night and got sent to a scary place with only a few people in it and it was hugely overpriced even for New York.
reviews.title: Good Location could do with new carpets

likes.disliked: — Furniture and carpets needed to be cleaned or replaced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fabulous vacation! The staff at the Affinia was absolutely fantastic!! Everyone that we dealt with was super helpful and friendly. The room was extra clean, comfy and so roomy. We loved the little kitchenette. Perfect for having breakfast in the room and then heading out for the day. The hotel was in a perfect spot-in a quiet neighborhood but still close to subways and attractions. You can pick up the Grey Line Tour bus just a couple blocks down from the hotel at the Empire State building. There is a little market right next to the hotel that is perfect for picking up groceries. We were there over the 4th and the hotel opened up a room that looked out over the East River to watch fireworks. We had the best view!! We will most definitely stay here again and most certainly recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better!!!!

likes.liked: — The bed was extremely comfortable with a choice of pillows.
likes.disliked: — The air conditioner was a little noisy.

reviews.text: Went for visit and biking in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Excellent value
I have lost my faith in Trip Advisors' ratings
reviews.text: Why the Affinia Dumont? My wife and I have been going to NYC on business twice a year since 2003 and have noticed a huge increase in prices for hotels across the city. OK, in 2003 NY was still suffering post-911 and prices were relatively cheap but the present economic crisis seems to have by-passed hotel owners in NYC so far.

reviews.title: Wonderful Location-Right by Subway Station
reviews.text: I mention this as I was looking for a hotel in the US300-400 a night range (still expensive enough, in my opinion) and the Affinia Dumont was like a beacon. In my price range, No. 6 in Trip Advisors' classifications, and a Travellers Choice winner in 2008...how could I go wrong?

reviews.title: Top Quality Hotel
reviews.text: I booked thru Aerlingushotels.com for two nights. Don't get me wrong because the hotel wasn't bad...but No 6 on Trip Advisor and a Travellers Choice winner ? Not so sure...

reviews.title: A bit of a mixed bag!
reviews.text: The front desk were courteous when we checked in but did not explain any of the hotels facilities to us. The hotel is known as a Fitness Hotel but I was told nothing about this. It has a Spa but again, I was told nothing.

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.text: The rooms WERE big by NY standards but a strong air freshener odour made you wonder "what smell are they trying to hide?" And 34th Street is one of those busy Thru Streets in NYC so traffic was a little noisy but, again, jet lag took care of that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had high expectations for this hotel given the reviews on this web site and that it's recommended by some very good travel agents, I'd expected somewhere that's well used and well run; I was disappointed. The Affinia Dumont is not all that good.
reviews.title: Under par: check other options.

likes.liked: — The size of the room and the location of the hotel in a quiet, well located neibourhood.
likes.disliked: — Shoddy management, bad front desk, being lied to. It's really serviced apartments and bed-sits.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally, the hotel is very well situated for connections around Manhattan. Murray Hill is relatively quiet for New York. The concierge team are really very good but are let down by an inconsistent front desk that left me with the impression that I was an inconvenience to be fobbed off on a number of occasions. The rooms are a decent size and, especially for larger parties, present good value for money. They're 8/10 clean but suffer from dust. Ventilation is not better than OK but the windows will open slightly. You may get a view. The decor is tired. In terms of facilities outside your room, there's a little used, well kept gym of +/-200 square metres, a similar sized lobby area with pay per time internet access and, adjacent, the Barking Dog restaurant which is convenient but worth missing given what the city has to offer. It serves over sized portions of motorway service station food.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Stay

likes.disliked: — The expensive internet & bottled water in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a luxury hotel despite what you'll read in other reviews.
reviews.title: Great place

likes.disliked: — Smoking next door neighbours = our room stank of cigarettes

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I chose the Affinia Dumont because I was running the NYC Marathon and wanted a larger room than is typical in the city and access to a kitchen which proved handy once we'd called reception a few times to get some pans. A good friend stayed there at the same time with five family members. We stayed 11 nights.
reviews.title: Brill hotel!

reviews.text: Specifically, I have a number of complaints about the hotel. We'd flown with my friend and one of her party. On arrival, the other four, who travelled on an earlier flight, had not been allowed access to their room. A pensioner, young woman and two teenagers were left to wait over six hours. This is despite the hotel having our credit card details and names on a secured reservation. The concierge team excused the attitude and lip we were offered from the reception as their being temporary staff. The following day, my friend and her family were offered a few bagel breakfasts in the Barking Dog in recompense.
reviews.title: What a SWEET stay!

reviews.text: TripAdvisor Stencil
reviews.title: Great stay at the Affinia Dumont - We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: Summary:
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Midtown Location

likes.liked: — Room was large and nicely appointed

reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Affinia Dumont – this was our fourth visit to the Big Apple and this was by far the best hotel we have stayed at in New York. The Affinia Dumont isn’t cheap but by Manhattan standards offers good value for money.
reviews.title: Loved the Affinia

reviews.text: When and why we stayed:
reviews.title: Best Experience

likes.liked: — Large rooms and comfortable clean beds
likes.disliked: — Cant think of anything did not have any complaints

reviews.text: We stayed at the Affinia Dumont for five nights in May 2008 during a vacation in Atlantic City and New York.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, great service, large rooms
great hotel
reviews.text: hotel welcoming after a harassed trip from airport iced tea and fresh fruit .( had checked trip adviser before booking and other comments were correct.) We had a studio with a view to the chrysler building room very comfortable . barhroom is small but who wants a big bathroom when the bed and room is large loved getting back after site seeing knowing there was a nice cold drink in fridge or a fresh tea . the deli near was great for fresh provision for breakfast. spent some time in the barking dog adjacent and bar staff excellent only when busy ,waitresses got a bit disorganised. will go back and will recommmend to friends etc nearly forgot all staff in hotel pleasant and helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hate to be one to follow the crowd, but the glowing reviews here are all spot on! My wife and I have just stayed at the Affinia Dumont for 5 days as part of our honeymoon and it exceeded our expectations on every level. Considering we'd been desperate to go to New York for years (this was our first time there) that's no mean feat!
reviews.title: Affinity with the Affinia Dumont!

likes.liked: — The spectacular view of mid-town Manhattan from our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having mentioned our honeymoon when making the booking, on arrival (early check-in) we rocketed up to the 24th floor and found we'd been upgraded to a large suite with kitchen, king bed and an amazing view over midtown Manhattan (including the Chrysler Building!). The room was spacious and incredibly well designed/furnished - a true slice of NY chic. They even provided us with a surprise complimentary bottle of champagne and a note of congratulations!
reviews.title: Great location, excellent hotel

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and attentive throughout our stay, helping us without a moment's delay when we asked for an international plug adaptor, looked like we needed a cab, or stored our luggage for 8 hours after checking out (we had a late flight home). This customer-focussed approach extended to staff at the excellent Barking Dog bar/restaurant next door, who also provided Room Service for the hotel. The portions were immense, but that's NY for you!
reviews.title: fabulous hotel, great price for NYC

reviews.text: The hotel's central location is a major plus point. Sat towards the east end of 34th St (a major shopping street as it turns out), several key sights/streets are within easy reach, with a subway station just one block away for getting to those attractions further afield. It's even on the same street as the Empire State Building and Macy's!
reviews.title: Loved Affinia Dumont!

reviews.text: My husband, teenage son and I stayed atthe Affinia for 3 days in July 2008 and really liked the hotel.
reviews.title: Very good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was handy fo all of the sights and was very comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Fabulous views and huge rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the 34 floor with a view downtown - this was excellent but I think a view up town with the chrysler building may be better.
reviews.title: Wow, what a fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — The view, the pillow menu and the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast in the Barking dog cafe which was very good and reasonable.
reviews.title: A Good All-rounder

likes.liked: — Good location and comfortable bed & pillow!
likes.disliked: — It is very noisy outside, and the airconditioning unit is also very noisy so you can't win! Take earplugs!

reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the Affinia Dumont in October 2005, and found it to be perfect in every way. The Junior Suite was spacious with a huge work table and return (for a computer). The lighting was excellent (so often lacking) and the bed was super-comfortable (although the King bed was a little too bouncy which made it hard for two people to sleep, so we requested a change to two Queens and they also gave us a nice view with the change on our second day). The fully equipped kitchen was a great convenience, to store our wine, cheese, milk, etc., and we even made breakfast two mornings. The kitchen was spotless, including the regrigerator, microwave, dishes, etc. The bathroom was also spotless. The shower was powerful and the toiletries are excellent quality. When this is described as being in a "residential neighborhood", that may be true, but it is a plus. There are delis, flower shops, restaurants, even a D'Agostino grocery store, on every block. Everything you could want is within a block or two. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly (see Donald for all your luggage and cab needs - he is adorable) and responsive. Do not eat at the Barking Dog next door; it is mediocre at best. There are plenty of other places. I did not even visit the fitness center or spa, and if I had, I am sure I'd have even more positive things to report. I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect stay
Brilliant!!!
reviews.text: Where can I begin. We arrived fairly early and being on our honeymoon we had requested a room on a high level. The room was not quite ready for us, so the porter took our cases and we went and eat next door at the Barking Dog. Just to add, food is superb from here highly recommend it. Getting back to the hotel, our room was the biggest I had ever been in, it was a studio apartment, but the bed could have slept four adults. Reading other reviews saying that new york hotels have the smallest rooms. If you want space come to this Hotel. We also had a kitchen with everything you could need. The views were amazing and the location was five minutes walk from empire state building. We loved New York and would definately go back to this Hotel. The staff were very helpful and would do anything for you ( and I dont believe this was just to recieved a tip either )Its a three star hotel, but I would give it five stars.

I could recommend this hotel to everyone, but I want a room here again the next time I visit, so let's keep it a secret. Clean, upscale, modern and with all the accessories/amenities you could want, including free use of a pedometer and CD player while you are there! We arrived late (at 1:00am) and they didn't have the exact room we requested (we wanted a high floor, king bed, non-smoking), but they upgraded us to a Jr. Executive Suite for our whole stay complimentary! Great views, excellent location and comfy beds, Aveda products, a kitchen that you can actually cook in, and never once did anyone "bother" us, including any noise from any other room! Can't say enough about our stay! Wonderful! Some say that the price can be a bit hig, but we got our room for $250/night including taxes & everything from Northwest Airlines website under their hotel section.
reviews.title: Welcome here any time

reviews.text: my husband and i stayed at this hotel on the basis of the reviews on here.
reviews.title: loved this hotel!
Made the holiday
reviews.text: We werent disappointed! it was an excellent hotel. Great location. within easy walking distance of the Empire State Building and surrounding parks/shops.

reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: Although it has been months since our stay this hotel stands out as one of the best hotel experiences I had in the past three years.

reviews.title: Well located, good views, clean, large rooms, efficient staff
reviews.text: The location was great for us as we took the train from Boston and walked the several blocks from the train station. With luggage it was interesting on the busy sidewalks so you might want to cab it but we love to walk as it helps us to get our bearings and really get to know a city.

reviews.title: Good hotel in a central location with lovely views
reviews.text: As we approached the building we could see scaffolding and both groaned in anticipation of construction noise. What a pleasant surprise then to be told by the Front Desk that our room was not ready so they would "bump" us up to one of the coveted (and more expensive) upper floors! I wasn't sure if we should do this (I have a terrific fear of heights) but the woman at the desk said we definitely should go for it as the room was great. She was right and I am so glad I made the move! We had a beautiful, spotless mini suite with a gorgeous view of the city. I was with my husband and he really appreciated the separate kitchen which was fully equipped. We didn't use it much but it was great knowing we could on a future trip!

reviews.title: NYC Summer City Tour
reviews.text: The king size bed was comfy and the linens high quality and spotless. The bath was elegant with fluffy towels and high quality bath products. I do believe we had to pay extra for internet which always kind of annoys me but that was truly the only bad note in an otherwise perfect stay.

reviews.title: Great Location and friendly staff!
reviews.text: There is a little breakfast place right next door but also plenty of other choices if you feel like wandering a bit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Affinia Dumont. We stayed in a wonderful 1 bedroom suite, we had decided to treat ourselves and it was well worth the extra money, the rooms are huge. We asked for a room on a high floor and was allocated a room on the 28th floor with a lovely view over the river. I cannot find anything to complain about other than receiving a bill for minibar items which we had not had, however, on booking out this was dealt with and the charge was deducted from our bill. A lovely hotel in a great location and if we visit New York again we would not hesitate to stay here.
reviews.title: Loved the Dumont

reviews.text: What a great stay we had at the Affinia Dumont! The people were very friendly and helpful. I requested a top floor and boy, did we get it! We were on the 37th floor in a corner room with an awesome 2-sided view. Sunrise over the East River was lovely...I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. Lovely rooms (spacious for Manhattan) and the Murray Hill Market next door was convenient for snacks and breakfast foods. I can't say enough about this place!!! Just Stay There!!!
reviews.title: love this hotel!!!!!

likes.liked: — great service and friendliness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay here. The room was a good size and the added bonus is that there is a kitchen great for breakfast. The location is in a residential area so there are plenty of bars, restaurants and shops nearby. The staff at the hotel are really helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Good Location and Friendly Staff
FAB stay at the Affinia Dumont!
reviews.text: We decided on the Affinia Dumont after seeing the reviews on tripadvisor and I can say that we were not dissapointed.

The rooms are large and comfortable with the little kitchenette coming in very handy to store our drinks etc. The beds are really good to sleep on ensuring a brilliant nights sleep. Be sure to ask for a high floor room and you will get a great view. Room 3606 which is where we stayed had a fantastic view across the Hudson river and Queens.
reviews.title: Worst attitude and customer service

reviews.text: We stayed for one night with 5 people in a very spacious 2 bedroom suite. The rooms are huge! The bed seemed comfy but was actually somewhat soft. But that's my only complaint. Noisy, but you expect that from NY. Ask for a room that does not face 34th Street. That may solve the problem.
reviews.title: Really great hotel but soft bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate a special birthday. The hotel is located in a great position, about 5-6 blocks from Penn Station.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Awesome Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a fabulous room on 36th floor (37 is highest) with a view of the Chrysler Building, we had the slightly bigger than normal size room which was massive and had a kitchen too.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was massive and so comfortable. The bathroom had a great shower, good pressure and a bathtub which I soaked in every night to relieve the feet from all the walking.
reviews.title: A great hotel in bustling Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in was quick and easy and they left me a bottle of wine and fruit as a gift for my birthday!
reviews.title: Truly beautiful hotel rooms, great value for NYC!!

likes.disliked: — Smoky smell very annoying, especially with their clean air promise

reviews.text: wonderful view of NYC, nice spa services, extra friendly staffs, you really get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Just like home!
Nice rooms, nice service!
reviews.text: Stayed one week during New Year. I went based on the reviews and everything is true! It is really a good hotel, with excellent service. All people are very kind and polite!

reviews.title: Great hotel. Great value.
reviews.text: Only thing bad was the check in/check out procedures. I somehow felt unshure of the charges made in my credit card. Both recepcionists looked a little bit unreliable during procedures. Appart from that...perfect!

reviews.title: an ordinary hotel
reviews.text: Most 4 star hotels we have stayed in are not as nice as the Affinia Dumont which for some reason is only rated 3 stars. The king junior suite was very attractive and roomy... and it has to be one of the best values in New York. Staff was extremely friendly, too. Location is convenient to both uptown and downtown. We'll be back.

reviews.title: Hmmmm, were we in a backpacker's nightmare?
reviews.text: The room was a good size and the bed - probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Cleanliness could not be faulted (although windows in need of a clean). Location was great - just round the corner from the subway on 33rd Street and within walking distance of many places.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 2002 at the back of the hotel which was fine. I asked for a higher one but this was all they could offer. We had a kitchen with full sized fridge, cooker, microwave and basic equipment. Warning to British customers - no kettle, just a coffee machine, enough for two cups.

reviews.title: A great stay - good location - wonderful staff
reviews.text: We bought our own cereals at the Murray Hill Deli nearby so breakfasted in our room which worked well. Ate in the Barking Dog twice which was ok.

aka: Affinia Dumont Hotel New York City
description: Nestled in vibrant Midtown East, Affinia Dumont has a little something for everyone. As one of the top boutique hotels in Midtown East NYC, business travelers admire our big desks and convenient location. Leisure travelers like our family-friendly suites with extra room for the little ones, and cruising around the neighborhood on our Republic Bikes. And everyone loves our Skyline Suites, with inspiring views of the historic Chrysler Building and tranquil East River. Join us nightly in our Midtown East hotel for a glass of red or white at our complimentary Wine Hour, located in the lobby from 5-6 p.m.
